Posts.Content: Hi I'm afraid I don't know much about my cancer apart from its ER+ invasive globular . I had mastectomy with implant reconstruction 3 wks ago so still swollen and bruising seems to be surfacing now. My hubby goes mad with me saying I'm a hypochondriac because I'm worrying about everything, I get my results tomorrow and am petrified they will say I need radiotherapy in case my implant then fails. I'm so worried that when I stop antibiotics I will get an infection, I'm constantly checking my temp the other night it was 34 so I googled it an it said hypothermia. Before all of this I was laid back I've had a lump I'm my breast for a few yrs they said it will just be scar tissue from cyst they have kept draining in the same spot that turned our to be cancer so I now have no trust in what my hospital says and the stupid breast nurse there said its prob only been there 4wks which worried me more because it was 37mm in size. Sorry for my rant but I to can't help but worry.
Posts.Title: sending myself crazy !

Posts.Content: Hi westie I had 6mm in one lymph node found in SNB at time of mastectomy I was not offered full clearence as my ornocologist said it would be over treating. I had oncotype dx which came back low so no chemo or radio just tamoxifen. I had SNB in May and my arm and shoulder are still sore numb with pins and needles.  Good luck on your choice X
Posts.Title: Partial or total lymph node clearance?

Posts.Content: Hi westie I had 6mm in one lymph node found in SNB at time of mastectomy I was not offered full clearence as my ornocologist said it would be over treating. I had oncotype dx which came back low so no chemo or radio just tamoxifen. I had SNB in May and my arm and shoulder are still sore numb with pins and needles.  Good luck on your choice X
Posts.Title: Partial or total lymph node clearance?

Posts.Content: Hi I'm afraid I don't know much about my cancer apart from its ER+ invasive globular . I had mastectomy with implant reconstruction 3 wks ago so still swollen and bruising seems to be surfacing now. My hubby goes mad with me saying I'm a hypochondriac because I'm worrying about everything, I get my results tomorrow and am petrified they will say I need radiotherapy in case my implant then fails. I'm so worried that when I stop antibiotics I will get an infection, I'm constantly checking my temp the other night it was 34 so I googled it an it said hypothermia. Before all of this I was laid back I've had a lump I'm my breast for a few yrs they said it will just be scar tissue from cyst they have kept draining in the same spot that turned our to be cancer so I now have no trust in what my hospital says and the stupid breast nurse there said its prob only been there 4wks which worried me more because it was 37mm in size. Sorry for my rant but I to can't help but worry.
Posts.Title: sending myself crazy !

Posts.Content: Hi winky I hope blood clot settles soon for you to move on with treatment we all seem to get setbacks. My surgeon said its normal my implant will always be cold, when I drink a cold drink it gets really cold but I'm a cold person normally. I hope all goes well with radiotherapy X
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi, after surgery I was told I needed 6 rounds of chemo but after speaking to others on this site I questioned it so my ornocologist did the ornotype dx test which took forever to come back. The test came back low and my ornocologist shuck my hand and said I no longer need him, I am now on tamoxifen for a while I think 5yrs. Carolyn28 gave me the advise I needed to question things and I do.  As for the size of implant I have I only know from bra fitting so please hang on you will once again be bra shopping without the feeling of a huge bouncy ball sitting on your ribs. The odd thing it always feels cold so might help with the hot flushes from tamoxifen Any questions please ask, my poor 21yr old daughter is sick of me showing my foob so if that gives you hope it will all be ok then have a chuckle at my anticts. Bug hugs x
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi when did the hot flushes start? I've not had them yet but do get a warm tingly feeling every few hours but not a hot flush. My implant reconstruction is quite big and always cold like having an internal fridge. X
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi both my tumours were low score, don't worry about taking tamoxifen I took it at night at first but found it kept me awake so I now take it in the morning and sleep better now. As for Zoladex if you don't want to do it then you don't have to it shuts down ovaries to bring on early menopause but tamoxifen stops the cancer been fed by hormones so I would take it. X
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi I have been on tamoxifen now for 2mth, the side effects I've had so far are sleepless nights when I took tablet at night so I now take in the morning, my joints ache first thing and I get emotional a bit like pmt but I guess body will get used to it in time. Considering apart from mastectomy this is my only treatment I feel quite lucky. X
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi I'm finding I'm a bit emotional on tamoxifen and my joints ache, I was told Zoladex injections to but then they changed to just tamoxifen so I would question why you need Zoladex as I have heard it can be hard going on it. What was your score from dx test and is your cancer er+ so hormonal fed. X
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi angie I am 47 I had mx with immediate implant reconstruction on 19th May and lymph node removal. The first wks are tough I kept thinking is it ok but surgeon said its fine my bcn was really nice and said baby steps everything will settle and it is starting to. I had infection in auxila where lymph nodes were removed but that is gone now. It all takes time just think you have been deconstructed and then reconstruction. Over time the swelling will get better and the implant will start to feel less hard, I am a 32g but my implant is about a. DD/E so still a big implant to get used to. I'm getting other breast reduced to match when implant is fully settled which surgeon said about Dec. Take things slow and time will make it better. I found antihistamines helped with swelling but remember there are lots of layers all storing tiny bits of fluid. Any questions please ask. Take care and rest. X
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi yes I have had no radiotherapy eithier. Just tamoxifen victory can call it just. X
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi I would insist on the lump been checked out properly.  I had a lump for a few yrs where a cyst was I kept been told don't worry it doesn't feel like cancer scans and mammogram didn't show it to be either but on the last time I insisted on going for tests the lump is now invasive lobular cancer and I have had to have a mastectomy. Go and push as much as you feel you want to. If my hospital had sent me for biopsy or MRI sooner I would have been caught sooner but all they say is invasive lobular is hard to detect early.  Please do not feel bad for knowing your own body and pushing for proper tests.
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: Hi I would insist on the lump been checked out properly.  I had a lump for a few yrs where a cyst was I kept been told don't worry it doesn't feel like cancer scans and mammogram didn't show it to be either but on the last time I insisted on going for tests the lump is now invasive lobular cancer and I have had to have a mastectomy. Go and push as much as you feel you want to. If my hospital had sent me for biopsy or MRI sooner I would have been caught sooner but all they say is invasive lobular is hard to detect early.  Please do not feel bad for knowing your own body and pushing for proper tests.
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: Hi I my PS said it was just fluid build up and the pains I'm having are muscle spasms. I'm finding it odd this feeling of carrying something around that is not part of me, I hope one day it stops but at the moment I really can just feel it pressing against me. I guess that's where the flap reconstruction is better but I'm to slim for one and even if I wasn't I think an extra scar area may be hard. I don't have a nipple anymore but my scar is in a T Shape like when you get an uplift because when he reduces the other side it will have the same scar line. My implant is a third smaller than my breast tissue he removed so I'm around a 32D or DD he thinks .
Posts.Title: Implants after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi I've had my implant reconstruction done 12days ago it's now very swollen and feels tight on my chest is this what you experienced I'm not sure what is normal. Also my drain fell out 2days ago  nurse said it will be ok but since then it's really swollen and is now leaking from incision site which still has dressings on. I'm seeing PS tomorrow to see if all ok or if I have haematoma. Nice to hear yours went well I had to fight my corner to get immediate reconstruction as I was advised by doing it I could be delaying treatment I may or may not need.
Posts.Title: Implants after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi thanks for your input I am seeing surgeon tomorrow I've not had dressings changed or checked yet as I hope it's just fluid build up. My drain fell out but I still have one in but both drains hardly had any fluid. My dressings are wet now so fluid must be making its way out. I'm having reduction and uplift on other breast later on when implant has settled down. I didn't know both could be done at same time.  Glad to hear your doing well. X
Posts.Title: Implants after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi I don't live close to surgeon I've used but he is really nice. I'm not sure what size I will end up with I think it looks about a D cup but my other is still a FF so I do look lopsided, my nipple was not saved as my cancer was to close for it to be saved I'm not sure if I will reconstruct that yet. I'm hoping my little set back is just fluid but I see surgeon tomorrow and will have surgery again on Friday if it is not just fluid. I will get my results back in about a wk from now fingers crossed they got it all out. X
Posts.Title: Implants after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi all I saw my PS today and he changed my dressings and removed the drain tube that was still in but not draining. He put a bit of pressure on my breast and lots of fluid came out of drain site which was a release of pressure on my skin. Still not allowed to get dressings wet and on antibiotics for another wk. I'm sure I will rattle soon from taking so many. Chest muscles are still in spasm. X
Posts.Title: Implants after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi glad to hear your doing well I wish both of mine were done at the same time it's really odd seeing 2 different size breasts and also I can't help but compare them, I know in the grand scale of things it shouldn't matter but emotions run a bit high sometimes. I'm only 14fays since surgery I get a bit tired around 2pm but I think that's because my dog goes into deep sleep then and I hear her snoring.  Now the extra fluid is out I'm more comfortable but my armpit and inside of my arm feel raw the breast nurse said its from lymph node removal.  Early days but I'm sure it will all be ok one day I'm just waiting for results back from mastectomy now and dressings come off again in another wk,  X
Posts.Title: Implants after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi I'm so sorry to hear you are having to fight it again. I've only known I have breast cancer for a few months so treatment plans not sorted out yet. When I told my brother who has a rare form of nasal cavity cancer which is attached to his brain he just said well they can cure breast cancer but they can't cure mine. How little do people know but I do think people think breast cancer is less serous as you hear so many with it.  All I can say is you do what you want it's your body and life. I believe quality of life is better than quantity. Above all don't just do things for others it's upto you and they should respect it. Take care and be strong X
Posts.Title: Not wanting anymore treatment

Posts.Content: Hi not sure if you have had implant replaced yet but I had implant done nearly 3wks ago I could not keep my nipple. The skin does feel a bit stretched but not thin. It's under the muscle with ADM used as well. I had to travel to get a surgeon I felt I trusted but if your not sure on what to do about failed implant see other surgeons to get better opinion. I'm still on mega strength antibiotics as the surgeon likes them to be taken for a min of 14days but as I still had fluid issues around my implant he has kept me on them longer.  Hope everything will be sorted for you soon. X
Posts.Title: Fed up due to failed implant. Next steps help please?

Posts.Content: Hi nice to hear a chat helped. I'm here also if you need to let of steam. My family are selfish I've not seen them once since my mastectomy but they were keen enough on telling me what I should do when I told them I had cancer . My husband is a rock X
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Hi I really feel for you having hot sweats and not feeling like you. I don't think anyone can ever understand fully as all people are different and if nice hair and make up is your thing it might seem nothing to some but a big deal to others. Don't dismiss anti depressants I started on them when I found out I had cancer and they help calm me down so I can think straigh or so I think. Everyone seems to think taking drugs for cancer treatment is fine so why not antidepressants if that's what you need to help with the brains chemical imbalance for a while. I take mine at night as it has a mild sedative effect and I sleep a solid 9hrs and wake up hungry before them I was awake all night and felt sick with worry  X
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: Hi Ossy I hope your feeling a little better today but if you want to cry then do it there is nothing wrong with crying. It's hard when your friends think your brave and your family don't bother. I'm exactly the same my family have not visited me once or helped in anyway but my husband has been a rock but it's hard on him when I get upset and he can't make it better. This site is like a little life line of understanding caring people. X
Posts.Title: Just feel like crying all the time

Posts.Content: IHi have you been offered radio? I only had 2 nodes removed not sure why only 2 but one has micro the other none. X
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi it's all very confusing hopefully we get answers soon. I was told no radio but chemo but like I've said I'm not keen if it's not going to make a huge difference have you tried nhs predict on line to see. Are you willing to do chemo if they say so regardless of % benifits to not doing it.
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn I think you should sit in an ornocologist chair I really like your logical thinking. I had my first meeting with ornocologist today and he openly said chemo is over used in as many as 50% of cases who really will not benifit from it but feel if they do they are doing something. I'm in a grey area so for me until my dx test is done I'm opting out of chemo but having tamoxifen and possibly zolafex to shut down ovaries as 8/8 ER+ so very hormone fed.  X
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi keep an eye on your temperature I had mastectomy in May but ended up back in hospital in July with infection I spoke to my bcn and said I felt shivery like getting a cold and she lots of colds around and don't worry but 3days later I was on IV antibiotics and then surgery. Check your temp and remember pain meds reduce your temp so try doing it before your due to take some or when shivery.  I hope all goes well X
Posts.Title: Fatigue and Shivers

Posts.Content: Hi I have invasive lobular. I've had mx and SNB it showed one lymph node to be possitive I and ER+ and have been told I need chemo but I'm meeting with ornocologist tomorrow. The nhs predict that I got told to look at shows chemo is only about 1.8% difference than not so I'm going to discuss it and see if maybe I could do radio to lymph nodes instead as I have not been told I need radio. My family has a history of heart conditions and I always have problems in surgery with my heart so this concerns me. Any treatment that is offered is your choice to take or not based on risks and benifits. I'm sure you will go through all of this and make an informed choice.  It's a lot to take in but time is on your side X
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi sasha have you decided for or against chemo yet and what is the benifits to having it against risks ?
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi let me know your outcome tomorrow I'm having my meeting to discuss chemo surgeon said I needed X
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi thanks for your reply. So far from the NHS predict tool chemo gives me less than 2% better odds so unless that changes i will not be doing chemo on those odds. I know a lot will say any % is better but for me it is not as I know to many who have had chemo and hit the magic 5yrs then wham it's back. I will do it if it comes back or if better odds
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi the waiting game is a killer if your wanting to know what or where next do we go from here, did you have lymph node involvement or just not got clear margins for possibility of needing chemo ?
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi I totally agree with you. I'm lucky I avoided chemo but if I had had to have it the loosing hair would have hit me hard like you say it's part of been feminine and these people have not had to go through treatment or loose a breast so to shave hair for charity is easy if that's what you choose to do but that's it they choose to. I enjoyed your rant.  X
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi jo I think if you want immediate reconstruction you should stand your ground I had a skin saving mastectomy with implant reconstruction, the scar goes down not accross so it looks a scar from a breast reduction. I to love to wear a bikini so the end result mattered to me. I know everyone has different choices but all that matters is what you want to do. X
Posts.Title: I've made my mind up!

Posts.Content: Hi I've not had diep but had a c-section and wore slogi pants for support but now they do special underwear in mother care that might be worth a try X
Posts.Title: Underwear woes after diep flap

Posts.Content: Hi I had implant reconstruction 7wks ago it's starting to settle down now but it feels really odd like it's rubbing on my ribs and a bit like a bouncy ball but I'm not sure if it would be the same with a smaller implant I have no nipple yet and not sure if I will bother but I have to have other side reduced to match as I was a 32ff and my new boob is a 32dd so I'm stuck in crop tops until I can wear a proper bra. I didn't have enough fat for any other type of reconstruction unless they did it and still had implant. It does look quite real but a little wide due to swelling and that's why I have to wait for other boob to be reduced to get the best match.  Good luck with your choice I'm pleased with implant and no other body part scarring or healing. Everyone who has seen it thinks it's fab X
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi I've had reconstruction with implant may 2017 I have to wait till Dec 2017 for my reduction on other breast to match. Hope all goes well X
Posts.Title: Reconstruction and reduction

Posts.Content: Hi it's very easy for people to say don't worry etc but you can't help it. I've been going for the past few yes with a lump and it's always been a cyst up til a couple of months ago when for some reason I went to different clinic and they found I have invasive lobular breast cancer which breast nurse told me has prob only been there 4wks. I've just had a mastectomy because they did an MRI and found another lump. I managed to keep this from my daughter vertical until I knew about surgery but when I told her she said she thought something was wrong. My diagnosis has made me loose trust in health professionals because I have found out lobular cancer doesn't show on mammogram but every time I went for tests they said its just a cyst but the last clinic said it was hiding behind cysts. If they had listened to me when I said each time you drain the cyst the lump is still there I might have saved my breast but you trust what they say. I'm sure the nurse is also wrong I can't see how a lump can be as big as 4cm in 4wks but then it not been urgent to remove it immediately. I hope you get a better outcome than me. X
Posts.Title: New, just been referred for fast track tests after finding lump

Posts.Content: Hi Misty thanks for your positive reply. Sometimes I think the feeling is due to size of implant I was a 32/34G and now I'm a 32/34E so a large implant to stretch muscle over. I had other boob reduced to match at end of Nov and that is healing well just tight scar tissue that's tender. Did you have odd sensations in your armpit all the time like I'm experiencing? I really don't like the feeling of the implant at the moment and hope it does improve. Thanks
Posts.Title: Implant reconstruction and SNB advise please

Posts.Content: Hi Lennie I'm pleased to hear you don't notice your implant I hope one day mine will feel like that but even just sitting writing this I feel it sitting/pressing on my ribs. Did you have armpit pain etc, also I still get a lot of swelling after any activity which makes the feelings worse. Thanks
Posts.Title: Implant reconstruction and SNB advise please

Posts.Content: Hi I wanted a bit of advise on is this normal. I had mastectomy and implant reconstruction back in May 2017 & SNB. Everytime I move my arm or do any light activity I get odd sensations and pulling feeling on my chest muscle, the implant was placed under muscle, I also have pain in my armpit which
Posts.Title: Implant reconstruction and SNB advise please

Posts.Content: Hi, I had mastectomy with implant reconstruction in May I'm due reduction on other breast next wk so I think it will not be a problem if you need to do this as you are entitled to simitary. I was a 32G but have gone down to a E cup but I'm finding its my implant shoulder that hurts as implant seems heavier than my natural breast. I hope you get to see a surgeon soon. X
Posts.Title: Breast reduction
